$1^{(2^{235423523})}$ represents the base 1 raised to the power of $2^{235423523}$. Since any number raised to the power of 1 is the number itself, regardless of the exponent, the result of any non-zero number raised to the power of 0 is 1. However, in this case, the exponent is $2^{235423523}$, which is not 0.

Therefore, the value of $1^{(2^{235423523})}$ is simply 1, because any number (including 1) raised to the power of an exponent that is not 0 is the number itself.

So, the final answer is:

$$\boxed{1}$$
